title: 1 John Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 John chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 John Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 John Chapter 5.

questions.question: Who is born of God according to 1 John 5:1?
options: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:1 states that whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:2, how do we know that we love the children of God?
options: When we love God and keep his commandments
questions.correctAnswer: When we love God and keep his commandments
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:2 explains that loving the children of God is shown by loving God and keeping His commandments.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5:3 say is not grievous?
questions.correctAnswer: His commandments
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:3 states that God's commandments are not grievous, and keeping them is love for God.

questions.question: What overcometh the world, according to 1 John 5:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Our faith
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:4 teaches that whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world by faith, and this faith is the victory.

questions.question: Who is the one that overcometh the world, as per 1 John 5:5?
options: He that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: He that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:5 states that he who overcomes the world is the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:6, Jesus Christ came by what two elements?
questions.correctAnswer: Water and blood
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:6 states Jesus Christ came by water and blood, not by water only but by water and blood.

questions.question: In 1 John 5:7, who bear record in heaven?
options: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost
The angels, the prophets, and the saints
The Son, the Spirit, and the Church
questions.correctAnswer: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:7 states that three bear record in heaven: the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:8, which three bear witness on earth?
options: The spirit, the water, and the blood
The prophets, the teachers, and the apostles
The law, the temple, and the sacrifices
The earth, the sky, and the sea
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit, the water, and the blood
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:8 explains that the spirit, the water, and the blood bear witness on earth and agree as one.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5:10 say about he that believeth not God?
options: He hath made God a liar
questions.correctAnswer: He hath made God a liar
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:10 states that he who believes not God has made Him a liar because he does not believe the record God gave of His Son.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:12, who hath life?
questions.correctAnswer: He that hath the Son
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:12 states that he who has the Son has life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 5:14, if we ask anything according to His will, God hears us.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:14 states we have confidence that if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 5:18 says that whoever is born of God sins often.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:18 states that whoever is born of God does not sin; he keeps himself and is protected from the wicked one.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 5:21 instructs to keep yourselves from idols.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:21 commands believers to keep themselves from idols.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 John 5:11: 'And this is the record, that God hath given to us ______ life, and this life is in his Son.'
questions.correctAnswer: eternal
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:11 states that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:19, what does the whole world lie in?
questions.correctAnswer: Wickedness
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:19 states that the whole world lies in wickedness.

medium.title: 1 John Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 John Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 John 5 teach us about the relationship between faith and victory over trials in life?
options: Faith in Jesus helps believers overcome the world
Victory comes only through good works
Trials are avoided by ignoring the world
Belief is not necessary for overcoming challenges
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in Jesus helps believers overcome the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:4-5 explains that those born of God overcome the world through their faith, specifically faith in Jesus as the Son of God. This shows that trust in Christ leads to victory over life's challenges.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with doubt about eternal life. Based on 1 John 5, what assurance can you share with them?
options: Those who have the Son of God have eternal life
Eternal life is uncertain and must be earned
Only those who are perfect receive eternal life
Eternal life depends on how much you pray
questions.correctAnswer: Those who have the Son of God have eternal life
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:11-12 clearly states that God has given eternal life through His Son, and whoever has the Son has life. This provides assurance based on faith in Christ, not on works or perfection.

questions.question: How does 1 John 5 instruct believers to express love practically within the family of God?
options: By loving both God and His children and keeping His commandments
By focusing only on loving God and ignoring others
By loving only those who agree with us
By avoiding commandments to show love freely
questions.correctAnswer: By loving both God and His children and keeping His commandments
questions.explanation: Verses 1 John 5:1-3 indicate that loving God and His children involves keeping His commandments, which are not burdensome. This teaches practical love as obedience and care for fellow believers.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, what role does the Holy Spirit play in affirming Jesus’ identity?
options: The Spirit testifies to the truth of Jesus coming by water and blood
The Spirit is unrelated to Jesus’ identity
The Spirit only works on earth, not in heaven
The Spirit teaches commandments without testifying
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit testifies to the truth of Jesus coming by water and blood
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:6 states the Spirit bears witness because the Spirit is truth, affirming Jesus' coming by water and blood, which emphasizes the Spirit's role in confirming Christ’s reality.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about prayer effectiveness. What biblical truth from 1 John 5 can encourage them?
options: If we ask anything according to God's will, He hears us
Prayer is only symbolic and has no real effect
God hears only prayers from perfect people
Prayer depends on how loudly we pray
questions.correctAnswer: If we ask anything according to God's will, He hears us
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:14-15 teaches that believers have confidence in prayer because God hears us when we ask according to His will, assuring us that our petitions are granted.

questions.question: Based on 1 John 5, how should believers respond when they see a fellow Christian sinning in a non-fatal way?
options: Pray for them so they may receive life
questions.correctAnswer: Pray for them so they may receive life
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:16 encourages believers to pray for brothers who sin a sin not unto death, showing the value of intercession and restoration within the community.

questions.question: How does 1 John 5 teach believers about guarding themselves from harmful influences?
options: Trust only in your own wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Keep yourselves from idols
questions.explanation: The closing verse, 1 John 5:21, exhorts believers to keep themselves from idols, emphasizing vigilance in spiritual devotion and avoiding false objects of worship.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5 teach about sin in the life of someone born of God?
options: They do not continue to sin habitually
They are exempt from any wrongdoing
questions.correctAnswer: They do not continue to sin habitually
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:18 says that whoever is born of God does not sin continually, and the evil one does not touch them, teaching a lifestyle of spiritual protection and growth.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, what is the significance of believing that Jesus is the Son of God?
options: It is the key to overcoming the world
It is a minor detail in faith
It leads to isolation from others
questions.correctAnswer: It is the key to overcoming the world
questions.explanation: Verses 1 John 5:5 highlight that the one who believes Jesus is the Son of God is the one who overcomes the world, emphasizing faith as victory over worldly challenges.

questions.question: How does this passage encourage integrity in daily life and witness to others?
options: By emphasizing that the Spirit, water, and blood agree as witnesses
By urging avoidance of any testimony
By focusing only on earthly achievements
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing that the Spirit, water, and blood agree as witnesses
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:8 teaches that these three agree as witnesses, showing the importance of consistent testimony in spiritual integrity and sharing the Gospel.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 5, God's commandments are burdensome and hard to keep.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:3 states that God's commandments are not grievous, meaning they are not burdensome but are an expression of love and practical obedience.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 5 teaches that if we do not believe God’s testimony about His Son, we make God a liar.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:10 explains that rejecting God's record about His Son is equivalent to calling God a liar, highlighting the seriousness of faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 1 John 5 teaches that whoever _________ hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
questions.correctAnswer: hath the Son
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:12 states that life is found in having the Son of God, emphasizing the necessity of a relationship with Jesus for eternal life.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand God better. What does 1 John 5 say has been given to help believers know the true God?
options: The Son of God who gives understanding
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of God who gives understanding
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:20 teaches that the Son of God has come and given us understanding so we may know the true God, emphasizing Christ as the source of spiritual knowledge.

questions.question: How does 1 John 5 encourage believers to live in light of the world's condition?
options: Knowing the whole world lies in wickedness, believers should remain faithful in God
Live like the world to fit in
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing the whole world lies in wickedness, believers should remain faithful in God
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:19 acknowledges the world's wickedness but reassures believers they are of God, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness.

hard.title: 1 John Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 John Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:1, what is the relationship between believing Jesus is the Christ and being born of God?
options: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God
Only the disciples of Jesus are born of God
Belief in Jesus is irrelevant to being born of God
Being born of God comes through observing the law
questions.correctAnswer: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:1 explicitly states that whosoever believes Jesus is the Christ is born of God, linking faith in Christ directly to spiritual rebirth.

questions.question: What is the key evidence of loving the children of God according to 1 John 5:2?
options: Loving God and keeping His commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Loving God and keeping His commandments
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:2 teaches that love for the children of God is evidenced by loving God and obeying His commandments, emphasizing obedience as an expression of love.

questions.question: In 1 John 5:3, how are God's commandments described in relation to love?
options: His commandments are impossible to follow
questions.correctAnswer: His commandments are not grievous
questions.explanation: The verse explains that keeping God's commandments is the very love of God, and that these commandments are not burdensome, reflecting the Hebrew concept of 'chayil' (strength) in obedience.

questions.question: What victory does 1 John 5:4 say those born of God achieve?
options: They overcome the world by faith
questions.correctAnswer: They overcome the world by faith
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:4 uses the theme of overcoming the world to describe the spiritual victory of believers, specifically through faith, echoing Old Testament motifs of triumph through divine empowerment.

questions.question: Who, according to 1 John 5:5, is the one who overcomes the world?
options: He that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: He that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: The text identifies faith in Jesus as the Son of God as the defining mark of the one who overcomes the world, tying soteriology with eschatological victory.

questions.question: 1 John 5:6 mentions Jesus came by water and blood. What is the theological significance of this dual testimony in the context of Johannine Christology?
options: It affirms Jesus’ authentic incarnation and atoning death
It refers to baptism and the Last Supper
It signifies the Jordan River and the Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms Jesus’ authentic incarnation and atoning death
questions.explanation: The reference to water and blood emphasizes Jesus’ full humanity (water, possibly baptism or birth) and sacrificial death (blood), crucial for combating early heresies denying either aspect.

questions.question: What are the 'three that bear record in heaven' according to 1 John 5:7, and what is their significance in Trinitarian doctrine?
options: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost; these three are one
The Father, Moses, and Elijah; these three are one
The Son, the Church, and the Prophets; these three are one
The Law, the Prophets, and the Psalms; these three are one
questions.correctAnswer: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost; these three are one
questions.explanation: This verse is a classic Trinitarian formula affirming the unity of God in three persons, reflecting early Christian theological development and countering anti-Trinitarian views.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:8, which three bear witness on earth and how do they relate to the heavenly testimony?
options: The spirit, the water, and the blood; these three agree in one
Faith, hope, and love; these three agree in one
The temple, the altar, and the sacrifice; these three agree in one
The law, the prophets, and the apostles; these three agree in one
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit, the water, and the blood; these three agree in one
questions.explanation: The earthly witnesses correspond to the Spirit (Holy Spirit), water (baptism or birth), and blood (death), paralleling the heavenly testimony and reinforcing the authenticity of Christ’s mission.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5:9 imply when it states, 'If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater'?
options: God’s testimony about His Son surpasses human testimony
Human testimony is more reliable than God’s
Witnesses must be corroborated by the elders
questions.correctAnswer: God’s testimony about His Son surpasses human testimony
questions.explanation: The verse highlights the superiority and ultimate authority of God’s own witness regarding Jesus, emphasizing divine revelation over human opinion.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5:10, what is the consequence for one who does not believe the record God has given of His Son?
options: He hath made God a liar
He will be forgiven if he repents
He will be honored among men
questions.correctAnswer: He hath made God a liar
questions.explanation: The verse asserts that unbelief in God’s testimony about His Son equates to calling God a liar, underscoring the gravity of rejecting divine revelation.

questions.question: What is the 'record' given to us as stated in 1 John 5:11?
options: Eternal life, and this life is in His Son
questions.correctAnswer: Eternal life, and this life is in His Son
questions.explanation: This verse declares that eternal life is a gift from God, found specifically in His Son, highlighting the central Christian doctrine of salvation through Christ.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He that hath the Son hath _____; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.' (1 John 5:12)
questions.correctAnswer: life
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:12 clearly states that having the Son is synonymous with having life, emphasizing the necessity of union with Christ for eternal life.

questions.question: What confidence does 1 John 5:14 say believers have when asking anything according to God's will?
options: We will be free from trials
questions.correctAnswer: He heareth us
questions.explanation: The verse assures believers that God listens to their prayers when they align with His will, encouraging faith and perseverance in prayer.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 5:18, those born of God are sinless and cannot be touched by the wicked one.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:18 states that whoever is born of God does not sin and is protected from the evil one, emphasizing divine preservation and ethical transformation.

questions.question: What warning does 1 John 5:21 give to the 'little children'?
questions.correctAnswer: Keep yourselves from idols
questions.explanation: The final verse warns believers, affectionately called 'little children,' to avoid idolatry, reflecting a consistent biblical theme against syncretism and false worship.

theological.title: 1 John Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 John Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, what is the evidence that someone is born of God?
options: Believing that Jesus is the Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Believing that Jesus is the Christ
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:1 states that 'Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God.' This aligns with John 1:12 and Galatians 3:26 which emphasize faith in Jesus as the mark of being God's child.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5 say about loving the children of God?
options: We love them when we love God and keep His commandments
We love them only if they are wealthy
We love them by giving offerings
We love them by avoiding them
questions.correctAnswer: We love them when we love God and keep His commandments
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:2 teaches that loving the children of God is evidenced by loving God and obeying His commandments, consistent with Jesus' teaching in John 14:15 and 1 John 2:3-6.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, how does the chapter describe the commandments of God?
options: They are for the elders only
questions.correctAnswer: They are not grievous
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:3 states that God's commandments are not burdensome, corroborating Jesus' words in Matthew 11:30 about His yoke being easy and light.

questions.question: What is the victory that overcomes the world according to 1 John 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Our faith
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:4 highlights that the victory over the world is achieved through faith, echoing the theme found in Romans 8:37 and Revelation 12:11 about faith conquering the world.

questions.question: Who does 1 John 5 say overcomes the world?
options: He that believes Jesus is the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: He that believes Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:5 affirms that belief in Jesus as the Son of God is the key to overcoming the world, consistent with John 16:33 and 1 Corinthians 15:57.

questions.question: In 1 John 5, Jesus is described as coming by water and blood. What does this signify?
questions.correctAnswer: His baptism and crucifixion
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:6 refers to Jesus coming by water and blood, traditionally understood as His baptism (water) and crucifixion (blood), correlating with Matthew 3:16 and John 19:34.

questions.question: Which three bear record in heaven according to 1 John 5?
options: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost
The angels, the prophets, and the saints
The heavens, the earth, and the sea
The moon, the stars, and the sun
questions.correctAnswer: The Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:7 identifies the three in heaven bearing record as the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost, reflecting the Trinitarian doctrine seen in Matthew 28:19 and John 1:1.

questions.question: What three bear witness on earth in 1 John 5?
options: The Spirit, the water, and the blood
The prophets, the priests, and the kings
The sun, the moon, and the stars
The law, the temple, and the sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit, the water, and the blood
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:8 speaks of the Spirit, the water, and the blood bearing witness on earth, which aligns with Jesus' baptism (water), crucifixion (blood), and the Spirit's testimony (John 15:26).

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, why is the witness of God greater than the witness of men?
options: Because God testified of His Son
questions.correctAnswer: Because God testified of His Son
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:9 explains that God's witness is greater because He testified concerning His Son, consistent with Hebrews 1:2 and John 3:31 where God's testimony about Jesus is supreme.

questions.question: What does 1 John 5 say about he who believes not God concerning His Son?
questions.correctAnswer: He makes God a liar
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:10 states that the one who does not believe God's testimony about His Son makes God a liar, paralleling John 3:18 and Romans 1:20 about rejecting God's revelation.

questions.question: What eternal gift has God given us according to 1 John 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Eternal life
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:11 affirms that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son, consistent with John 3:16, Romans 6:23, and Titus 1:2.

questions.question: According to 1 John 5, what does he who has the Son have?
questions.correctAnswer: Life
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:12 states that he who has the Son has life, and he who does not have the Son of God does not have life, which echoes John 1:4 and John 5:24.

questions.question: What confidence do believers have when they ask according to 1 John 5?
options: That if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us
That their prayers will always be answered immediately
That God is obligated to grant their wishes
That they will not face trials
questions.correctAnswer: That if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:14 teaches that believers have confidence that God hears us if we ask anything according to His will, consistent with Matthew 6:10, John 15:7, and James 4:3.

questions.question: How does 1 John 5 describe the sin which is 'not unto death'?
options: A sin for which one may pray and receive life for the sinner
A sin that leads to eternal punishment
A sin that is forgiven without repentance
questions.correctAnswer: A sin for which one may pray and receive life for the sinner
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:16 explains that if a brother sins a sin not unto death, prayer can bring life for him, reflecting the intercessory role of the church and God's mercy found in James 5:16 and Matthew 18:15-17.

questions.question: What warning does 1 John 5 end with?
questions.correctAnswer: Keep yourselves from idols
questions.explanation: 1 John 5:21 concludes with the exhortation to keep ourselves from idols, which echoes Old Testament warnings in Exodus 20:3 and 1 Corinthians 10:14 against idolatry.
